medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient, a 7-year-old boy, presented with focal seizures and progressive right-sided weakness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 18 months prior with intermittent shaking of the right hand, which progressed to the entire right arm. Approximately 2 months after onset, twitching of the arm became nearly constant and facial twitching started. Symptoms recurred approximately 3 months later. Over the past year, the right arm and face twitched nearly continuously with 2 to 20 clonic activities daily, associated with progressive weakness, spasticity, and subtle weakness of the right leg.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born at 36 weeks gestation and had reactive airway disease. He underwent tonsillectomy, adenoidectomy, and urologic surgery. No other relevant medical history is specified.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes attention deficitâ€“hyperactivity disorder in the mother and sibling, bipolar disorder in a paternal aunt, and depression in other paternal relatives.
medical_history.social_history: The patient consumed a ketogenic diet, participated in occupational and physical therapy, lived with his parents and older sibling, and was in second grade.
